instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
This arrived with no backlight but machine still boots and chimes. minor liquid spill on <CHIP>U8330</CHIP>. Replaced but no change.

There is 5v at the screen but no 0V on backlight. Using a known good screen. <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is only 0.300V

Can this be bad CPU/PCH since <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> comes from it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> steady high?
Can you confirm if image is present?
<SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> goes high?
Do you get 3V at pin 5 of J8300?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> steady 2.4v

Yes image is present

<SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> yes 3.3v

yes 3v at pin 5 of j8300

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Be sure to test with compatible screen for this year model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: I am. The same screen works fine on another 4924 board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
You should have something more affected by liquid.
Compare diode mode to ground readings on that area with the good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: diode mode readings are very close and some exact to good board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Possibly liquid spill damaged PCH through the backlight control lines.

Just in case, do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> should be high; check it anyway...
